definitions.definition: Possible to excuse ; worthy of being excused.

Describing an illegal act that was committed involuntarily , for example under false information or because of a faulty device. Distinguished from justifiable , describing an illegal act that was intentional but justified for other reasons.

main_definition: Possible to excuse ; worthy of being excused.
secondary_definitions: ( law , specifically ) Describing an illegal act that was committed involuntarily , for example under false information or because of a faulty device. Distinguished from justifiable , describing an illegal act that was intentional but justified for other reasons.
